intro: Smythea beccarii, commonly known as the beccarii smythea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
